greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sum_{n >= 1} n!/p(n), where p(n) = [n/1]!*[n/2]!*...*[n/n]!, and [ ] = floor.
comment: Let t(n) = n!/p(n). Then t(n) is an integer for n = 1..15, and max{t(n), n = 1..infinity}} = t(23) = 77452.802... . It appears that t(n) < 1/10 for n > 35 and t(n) < 10^(-6) for n > 45.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 13 2014
